unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop elementary level skills in reading, writing, listening and speaking in the Italian language.
Identify, describe and evaluate a few aspects of Italian-speaking cultures and societies.
Demonstrate an awareness of some language and language use in both Italian and English.
Identify, evaluate and deploy the grammatical structures of Italian at elementary level.
Apply relevant language conventions to create meaningful intercultural encounters.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Students are expected to spend time on daily review of grammar and vocabulary, and Italian practice. Students should be familiar with the content of a week before attending their following seminar and feel comfortable with each week's content before starting a new week.

enrolment_rules.description: Not to count for credit for students who completed HSC Italian beginners Band 4 and above, HSC Italian Extension, HSC Italian Continuers

assessments.description: Online assessment covering individual book chapters. These exercises are based on the workbook material accompanying the text book.
These written tests cover the material present in the books chapter studied up to that point.
Students are required to prepare and perform a role play in Italian.
The final test covers all material studied in the unit.
Weekly activities to check and confirm active engagement with course material.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Fully online/virtual
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances, North Ryde

academic_org.value: Department of Media, Communications, Creative Arts, Language and Literature

data.description: This unit is for beginners or near-beginners in Italian, and presupposes no prior knowledge of the language. The unit provides a systematic study of the basic grammar and idioms of standard Italian. It has an essentially practical aim directed at functional language usage, and oral and written expression.
data.title: I Italian Studies 1
